Title: Ashes of a Song
Text:
Marcel didn’t ask me to, but something in the way he spoke about the music — and that burnt house down Drabus Street — made me want to look.
There might still be something left among the ashes. A cassette, a sound, a feeling...
Something to remind him of better days.
CompleteText:
The tape smells faintly of smoke and dust, but the label’s still there, worn but legible.
Marcel holds it like it’s made of glass. He doesn’t say much. Just nods, once, like a memory settled into place.
Some things can’t be fixed. But they can be remembered.
